Redesigning hiring practices to increase equity and inclusion in Environmental Data Science (EDS) Chapter 1 Idea

Redesigning hiring practices to increase equity and inclusion in Environmental Data Science (EDS) Margaux Sleckman, Elmera Azadpour, Ian Brunjes, Ciera Martinez, Michelle Tigchelaar 2023-03-07 Chapter 1 Idea The EDS Hiring Manifesto is a living document that serves as a hiring resource and provides recommended best practices for applying and recruiting that will increase equity and inclusion in the Environmental Data Science (EDS) workforce. Abiding by the DEIA principles, the approach detailed in this manifesto will serve as a primary standardized resource for hiring managers as well as job seekers in EDS. We hope this manifesto allows the discipline to wholly embrace an inclusive & transparent recruitment process and help create a professional culture where all identities can participate, thrive, and have satisfying and rewarding careers. Here we lay out the problem space and provide approaches to expand diversity, equity, inclusion and accessibility (DEIA) in the hiring process. From Berhe et. al, 2002 - Credit: Mvmet

Chapter 2 Problem The standardized hiring process for environmental data science positions leads to exclusion of diverse candidates Employers are missing a lot of applicants by: Reach: not sharing hiring information to large enough pool Transparency: application process is complex Timing: can be a long process Documentation: normalized document requirement that might not be a means to get in the door Titles: title may not accurately match responsibilites Chapter 3 - Approach sets out to curate sharable resources that raise awareness about hurdles and biases and present best practices to address or overcome these problem spaces.
